headline: Wells Fargo, SunTrust Add Mobile Check Deposit To Banking Apps
short descr: Last month, Bank of America rolled out a remote deposit app and other big banks including JP Morgan Chase, Citibank, PNC
image_caption(s): File photo date 01/07/08 of an Apple iPhone as three-quarters of parents with smartphones share apps with their children and more than a third consider them to be an 'integral' part of family life, according to a study.
article: When it comes to personal banking, the smartphone can now accomplish most of what a bank teller or an ATM can do, aside from actually dispensing cash (iPhone 6 feature, perhaps?).Two more big banks, including Wells Fargo and Sun Trust, have revamped their banking apps to allow customers to make deposits on the go by snapping a photo of a paper check using a smartphone's built-in camera. As of last week, Wells Fargo, which is the fourth largest bank in the country, allows customers in a dozen states to make mobile check deposits with their iPhone and Android apps. The bank said it plans to make the feature available to the rest of the country by the end of the year, according to MyBankTracker. SunTrust Bank, which has 1,651 branches in the Southeast and is based in Atlanta, has also rolled a mobile photo remote deposit feature available to customers using either Android or iPhones last week, American Banker reported. Last month, Bank of America rolled out a remote deposit app and other big banks including JP Morgan Chase, Citibank, PNC and USAA also offer remote deposit apps. Community banks are also starting to offer mobile deposit to compete with larger banks. While the promise of remote check deposit is alluring, one Bank of America customer had trouble getting the app to work correctly. The New York Times Bucks blog recently reviewed some of the technical hitches, such as getting the photo capture to accurately read a hand-written paper check. The rise of mobile banking comes as branch banking is on the decline. Some banks have been reducing the number of brick-and-mortar locations they operate. Do you use a mobile app to deposit your paper checks? Does it work well for you or have you had issues with your bank?

headline: Kim Kardashian Knows How To Dress Her Curves (PHOTO)
short descr: Click here to see Kim Kardashian's style evolution. WHO: TV personality, entrepreneur and Kanye's better half, Kim Kardashian
image_caption(s): Kirna Zabete for TargetÂ® Long-sleeve Blazer in Navy/Black Colorblock, $49
article: WHO:  TV personality, entrepreneur and Kanye's better half, Kim Kardashian WHAT: The reality star looked amazing in an ensemble that hugged her in all the right places. The sex-symbol sported a long navy blazer with a black pencil skirt (we love that color combo). The short hemline is an ideal choice for the petite Kardashian while the bold-shouldered jacket is the perfect counterbalance to her curvacious bod. Of course, it wouldn't be a signature Kim Kardashian look without impossibly high heels or lots of mascara. WHERE: Kimmy K was seen leaving the studio after an appearance on "Good Morning America" in New York City on September 13th. Click here to see Kim Kardashian's style evolution.
